Simple wrapper to toCamelCase which sets lowerCase to false.

Parameters:
string - the string to transform.
Returns:
a version of string, whose first character is upper-cased.
See Also:
toCamelCase(String, boolean)

toCamelCase

public static String toCamelCase(String string,
                                 boolean lowerCase)
Transform the specified string to its camel-case representation. That says, the first character of string will be changed to its upper-case representation. If lowerCase is true then the remaining characters will be changed to their lower-case representations, else the case will be kept as is. For example, say string is "text", then this function will return "Text". Else, if for example, string is "teXT" and lowerCase is false then "TeXT" will be returned (if lowerCase is true then it would be "Text"). If string is the empty string (""), this function will just return string.

Parameters:
string - a string to transform.
lowercase - true to lower-case the characters in the range [1..string.length()].
Returns:
the camel case version of string.
See Also:
toCamelCase(String)

join

public static String join(String separator,
                          String... strings)
Joins a number of strings together to form one long string, with the optional separator inserted between each of them. This method is implemented as convenience wrapper for the join(String, Collection) method.

Parameters:
separator - a string to insert between each of the strings or null.
strings - a variable list (an array) of strings.
Returns:
a string containing all of the strings joined together with separator between them.
See Also:
join(String, Collection)

join

public static String join(String separator,
                          Collection<String> strings)
Joins a number of strings together to form one long string, with the optional separator inserted between each of them.

Parameters:
separator - a string to insert between each of the strings or null.
strings - a Collection of strings.
Returns:
a string containing all of the strings joined together with separator between them.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if strings is null.
